Player History
Signed as a free agent by New York (N) on 2/11/1966 to a 3-year deal worth $6,700,000 per year...
Hit 3 homeruns against Chicago (N), driving in 4 runs on 6/1/1966...
Won Batter of the Month award on 9/1/1966, hitting .398 with 5 HR, 20 RBI...
Drove in 6 runs against Pittsburgh on 9/2/1966...
Won Batter of the Month award on 10/1/1966, hitting .402 with 8 HR, 23 RBI...
Was selected to the 1967 Allstar game...
Won Gold Glove Award at First Base in 1967...
Was selected to the 1968 Allstar game...
Won Gold Glove Award at First Base in 1968...
Won Player of the Week award on 9/1/1969, hitting .455 with 2 HR, 6 RBI...
Won World Series with New York (N) in 1969...
Won Gold Glove Award at First Base in 1969...
Traded from New York (N) to Boston on 5/28/1970 (Going to NYM: P D. Cheadle. Going to BOS: 1B D. Demeter)...
Injured on 6/3/1970 with a Swollen Ear, out for 6 days...
Drafted in 1st round, 9th overall pick, by Minnesota in 1972...
Injured on 5/3/1975 with a Tight Knee, out for 1-2 weeks...
Injured on 7/13/1975 with a Tight Shoulder, out for one week...
Had first career hit on 4/16/1976, off Jeff James (CHW)...
Hit first career homerun on 4/18/1976, off Burt Hooton (BAL)...
